meanings.sent1: She always outcooks her friends when they have cooking competitions.
meanings.sent2: My grandma outcooks everyone in the family with her delicious pies.
meanings.sent3: The little girl outcooks her toy kitchen, pretending to be a famous chef.
meanings.sent4: In the kitchen, she outcooks the competition like a master chef.
meanings.sent5: His passion for cooking drives him to outcooks others with his unique recipes.

meanings.definition: The act of surpassing in cooking ability.
meanings.sent1: Her outcooks of the day was the perfectly baked lasagna.
meanings.sent2: The outcooks of the cooking show impressed the judges.
meanings.sent3: The outcooks of the potluck was the homemade apple pie.
meanings.sent4: His outcooks in the kitchen earned him the title of top chef.
meanings.sent5: The outcooks of the bake-off left everyone craving more of her treats.
